div.p: ‘To Athenodorus, chief of police, from Theonous (?) son ofTheon, estate-agent of Evander son of Ptolemaeus, priest of Tiberius Caesar Augustus. In the month Pauni of the 18th year of Tiberius Caesar Augustus, as I was making an inspection of the land belonging to Evander in the area of Euhemeria, I found that the shepherds of … son of Eunomius had caused the sheep which they tend to feed on 26 sheaves ... I ask you to write to the archephodus of the village … Farewell. (Endorsed) To the archephodus: Send them up. The 18th year of Tiberius Caesar Augustus, Epeiph 16.
